intro: Bihania, commonly known as the "wild ginger" or "false cinnamon," is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant contains aromatic compounds that have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Bihania is often found in moist, shaded environments in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Its unique morphology and chemical composition make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
